content.content: In the United States 423,000 patients (60 years and older) were hospitalized with blood clots (VTE) in 2010.[^106] A blood clot forms when blood cells clump together and change the blood flow in a vein.[^107][^108][^109] ![Blood clot](//images.ctfassets.net/xbvvg00rroa3/2npwuuP9WsAoYokYS0awas/788e1805ba3cb7a3dfeffa7c348fa895/Blood_clot.jpg) Symptoms:[^107][^108][^109] - Pain - Swelling - Discoloration (blue or red) - Warmth ![DVT Stock](//images.ctfassets.net/xbvvg00rroa3/1RK4SMzNEwWAuW6OCwMsE2/2f3bd29aee31e0a9f1ba72f5cf823014/DVT_Stock.jpg) Embedded content: https://youtu.be/cLbncqbBYg0?list=LL31GglpqkW9B1NW8eHUZ-CA ## Pulmonary Embolism (PE) A pulmonary embolism (lung clot) is when a blood clot (venous thromboembolism) moves to the lungs.[^107][^108][^109] Symptoms:[^107][^108][^109][^111] - Shortness of breath - Chest pain - Unexplained cough - Unexplained rapid heart rate. ## Blood Clot Prevention Embedded content: https://youtu.be/vNArtKdLPC8 1. Ask your doctor and nurse: "What will be done to prevent blood clots?"[^107][^108][^109][^111][^112] 2. Ask if you or the patient will be taking a blood thinning medication.[^107][^108][^109][^111][^112] 3. Make sure the patient's compression stockings and boots (sequential compression devices) are plugged in and working while the patient is in bed or sitting in a chair.[^7][^10] 4. Only walking is not enough to prevent blood clots.[^107][^108] 5. Aspirin alone will not prevent blood clots.[^113] [Blood Clot information from the National Blood Clot Alliance](https://www.stoptheclot.org/spreadtheword/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/NBCA-Infographic.pdf) [Acute Blood Clots from Choosing Wisely by the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM)](http://www.choosingwisely.org/patient-resources/acute-blood-clots/) [Deep Vein Thrombosis Information from the National Library of Medicine](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/deepveinthrombosis.html) [VTE information from the World Thrombosis Day](http://www.worldthrombosisday.org/issue/vte/) [^7]: Hallisey J.
